Case reference: 2016068701.CaseDesc: On June 9, 1968, a male was recovered from the Detroit River just below Fighting Island, Amherstburg, Anderdon Township. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 180 lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. It is believed that he had been in the water for several months prior to recovery.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Several teeth were missing. The remaining teeth had amalgam or porcelain fillings.
Shirt: Brown, checkered sport shirt; button-front and long-sleeved

Case reference: 2014005187.CaseDesc: In the afternoon of December 29, 1960, Helga Kaserer was seen for the last time in the area of Harvard Avenue and Roncesvalles Avenue in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005585.CaseDesc: In December 2010, Amanda McLeod was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2005005499.CaseDesc: On June 28, 1991, an unidentified man was discovered in the Niagara River located in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Shoes: White, Running, Brand: "Pro Wing Eagle"; size 12
Socks: White, Blue, White socks with a blue stripe
Scar: Right Leg, 24cm in length, on the inside of right lower leg, from ankle to upper shin
Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Leg, Healed fracture of the tibia

Case reference: 2012020139.CaseDesc: On November 15, 1981, 16 year old Myriam Isabelle Kniaz was seen for the last time at the residence of her foster family located in Ste-Foy, Quebec .

Case reference: 2018029824.CaseDesc: Azizollah Nabizadeh was reported missing on April 30, 2018, by his mother, who resides in Sweden. Azizollah had informed her that he was residing in Toronto, Ontario when last they spoke 7 years prior. The last evidence police could find of Azizollah in Canada dates back to 1995.

Scar: Mouth, Small scar below the mouth

Case reference: 2014005313.CaseDesc: On September 24, 2007, Azelea Brown last spoke to her mother who was overseas.

Case reference: 2017068602.CaseDesc: On August 13, 2017, Martin Bertram McLearn was seen for the last time. He has moderate dementia and was reported missing from his home.

Boots: Rubber, Size 7; old, worn and cracked

Case reference: 2010003599.CaseDesc: Alexander McAuley was reported missing by family members on April 23, 2010, after not having any contact with him since 2002. Mr. McAuley was known to lead a high risk lifestyle and may have met with foul play.

Case reference: 2014047277.CaseDesc: On December 16, 2014, at approximately 10:30 a.m., Abdool Kisson was last seen leaving his ex-girlfriend’s house in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004990.CaseDesc: On January 6, 1978, at approximately 11:00 p.m., John McNichol was seen for the last time as he left the Crock & Block restaurant located in downtown Kitchener, Ontario. John had met with a friend that evening, and the two had planned to see each other again the next day. The following morning, he failed to show up for work and a note was found stating that he had to leave.

Luggage: SUITCASE, Suitcase, contained Leonard Cohen records
Shirt: Orange, « Grandma Lee » checkered, short sleeve

Case reference: 2014002202.CaseDesc: On May 5, 1991, Doctor Jitinkumar Devchand Karamshi Shah, a physician with Sir Thomas Roddick Hospital in Stephenville, Newfoundland, was last seen at 2:45 in the morning. After a night out at a local club, Dr. Shah dropped a friend off at their residence and continued walking home. Dr. Shah was born in Nairobi, Kenya and previously lived and worked in Sheffield, England.

Case reference: 2014003751.CaseDesc: Lucien Sale was last seen driving his truck in Chisholm, Alberta on September 21, 1991. On September 26, 1991, his truck was located abandoned on a logging road off into the bush.

Case reference: 2018043194.CaseDesc: On July 13, 1990, Laura Hamilton was last seen by her fiancé leaving a restaurant in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006020499.CaseDesc: Theodore Piekarz was initially reported missing in 1978. Piekarz was planning a trip to British Columbia. He was seen at the Kirkland Lake Train Station in October 1986. Mr. Piekarz may suffer from mental health issues, including suicidal tendencies.

Mark: Nose, mole on the right side of his nose

Case reference: 2005152590.CaseDesc: Helen went for a walk and did not return. At the time of her disappearance, Helen had only been in Prince George for a few weeks.

Case reference: 2013000055.CaseDesc: Ronald Donelle has been missing since November 16, 2001. He was last seen dropping off his ex-wife in front of her home located in the Pierrefonds-Roxboro district in Montreal, Quebec. His vehicle has not been located.

Case reference: 2014003001.CaseDesc: Mr. Westbrook was last seen during the late afternoon/early evening hours on September 8, 1994. Mr. Westbrook had stopped at the Highwayman Restaurant located at 3001 Highway 11 North to gas up a motor home as he was attempting to return to Strathroy, Ontario. Family members had followed him in their vehicle and took away his keys to prevent him from driving any further as they were concerned about his driving. After a confrontation with his family members he was last seen walking southbound on Highway 11 in an agitated state. He was observed walking and hitchhiking heading towards the city of North Bay, ON. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014001042.CaseDesc: On July 22, 1991, the body of an unidentified woman was found floating in the Atlantic Ocean near Georges Bank in Newfoundland and Labrador. Evidence shows that the woman had a previous caesarean section, as there was a scar on her pelvic area and there were sutures in her uterus. The woman had worn front top incisors with a slight overlap and had a fractured upper front tooth.

Case reference: 2014003678.CaseDesc: On June 21, 1960, Donald McKillop's wife reported him missing to the Police. The last time she spoke to her husband was on June 19. She was working away from the home and returned on the June 20 to find her husband away.   Mr. McKillop's wife indicated to police she had spoken to her husband and he had not indicated he was leaving for any reason. Donald McKillop left the home without his wallet, there was no clothing missing and all his carpentry tools were present. Inquiries with family and friends revealed nothing else. Mr. McKillop had no history of mental disorder or suicidal tendencies.  There is no indication of foul play in his disappearance.

Case reference: 2006001699.CaseDesc:
On July 27, 1992, the body of a male, believed to be Caucasian, was found in the Toronto Harbour of Lake Ontario. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 160lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.
His upper right central incisor had a root canal treatment and there was a metallic restoration at its root end. There were several other sites of root canal treatment.
His appendix was present and he was uncircumcised.

Teeth: Many post. teeth & U-left lat. incisor:missing before death. Many fillings amalgam & composite. U-right cent. incisor: grey
Shoes: Blue and white "L.A. Gear" running shoes
Shirt: Black, T-shirt, "True North Sweats Designer " brand

Case reference: 2014005597.CaseDesc: On October 1, 2010, André Benoit was last seen at his home in Sainte-Marguerite-du-Lac-Masson. André may have gone to Montreal in the days preceding his disappearance. The attempts to locate Mr. Benoit have been negative to this date.

Case reference: 2014004031.CaseDesc: On April 30, 1974, Earland Christopher Feldseth was seen for the last time at a grocery store in Tofino, British Columbia. On April 11, 1974, Earland had set sail on a fishing trip on his 39-foot Fishing Trawler from Steveston Fisherman's Wharf in Richmond, British Columbia, with his 1969 Triumph motorcycle secured to the stern. Earland has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2006024599.CaseDesc: Chester Sawyers was last seen outside of a camp in Lochalsh (Riggs Township), Ontario on June 8, 1990.  It was reported that he was upset and indicated that he was heading home. It was believed that Mr. Sawyers left on foot and he has not been seen since.

Wallet: Brown, MasterCard, Canadian Tire Card, a driver's license

Case reference: 2006015899.CaseDesc: Pamela Holopainen was last seen in the city of Timmins, Ontario in the early morning hours of December 14, 2003, following a house party.

Case reference: 2009004999.CaseDesc: At the time of her disappearance, Dawn Carisse was a patient of the North Bay Psychiatric Hospital. She is generally very pleasant though suffers from short term memory loss due to cardiac arrest several years earlier.  Dawn Carisse always spoke of leaving the hospital and going to where she believed her family would be. Her family was in the Kirkland Lake area and then moved to Sudbury. She was aware of both, and her possible destinations were Kirkland Lake or Sudbury. She was last seen on Highway 11 North, in North Bay, Ontario.

Hair: Brown, Curly, Parted in centre, short bangs
Luggage: May have had a dark duffle bag in her possession.
Dress: Maroon, Pink, Long dress with faint white flowers, short sleeves and front buttons.

Case reference: 2015019929.CaseDesc: On April 16, at approximately 9:00 a.m., Sribavan Kandasamy was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004684.CaseDesc: Mr. Claude Gagné disappeared from the sector of Lac des Passes in a forested area near the municipality of La Tuque between September 1st and 2nd, 2000. His boat was found on the shore of the lake with the electric motor at the running position, and his car was found parked at the camp at the same lake. He went to the camp by himself and has never been seen since.

Case reference: 2021048330.CaseDesc: On July 12, 2015, at approximately 7 :00 a.m., Dan Ingram was seen for the last time as he slipped and fell into the water near the Whirlpool State Park in Niagara Falls, New York.

Scar: Left Forearm, From wrist to elbow

Case reference: 2014003554.CaseDesc: On May 30, 1986, Edward Ludwig was seen for the last time as he left his work site at the Bow Valley Provincial Park in Canmore, Alberta. At this time, Edward was on his way to go boating on Lake Minnewanka in Banff National Park in Alberta. His boat was found empty floating on the lake. During the time of his disappearance, Edward was despondent.

Case reference: 2017023444.CaseDesc: In July 1948, June Pauline Stevens was living in Cadillac, Saskatchewan when she disappeared and has not been heard from since. Ms. Stevens was thought to have travelled west to Port Alberni, BC to join her mother or to Winnipeg, MB to join other relatives.

Case reference: 2016041786.CaseDesc: LeRoi La France was reported missing on March 31, 2016 when LeRoi’s siblings learned that a formal missing person report had never been made regarding their brother. He was last seen in October or November of 1964. In 1964 LeRoi was a student at UBC who lived in Burnaby BC and insured a 1952 VW Beetle.

Case reference: 2014005713.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1980, Michael Konopekly was seen for the last time when he went fishing on Pallet Lake, near Cochrane, Ontario. Mr. Konopekly’s canoe, paddle and fishing rod were located at the lake, but Mr. Konopekly was not located.

Case reference: 2006012199.CaseDesc: Leonel Phillips left Butterfield Lodge by boat to travel on Lake Matinenda (Blind River, Ontario) to Log Chateau. Mr. Phillips' boat was located adrift but he was never found. He is presumed to have drowned.

Scar: Chest, A burn scar below his right breast

Case reference: 2015063998.CaseDesc: On October 6, 2015, Erin McGonigal was last seen leaving her home. Erin's home is located in the area of Dundas Street and Cawthra Road, Mississauga, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002473.CaseDesc: On July 4, 1991, Gabriel Bukredji was seen for the last time in the Saint-Leonard district of Montreal, Quebec. Gabriel was despondent and had also mentioned he was interested in purchasing property in another country.

Sweater: Pink, Blue circle on the back.

Case reference: 2005007699.CaseDesc: On July 9, 1986, a Caucasian male was found in the Don River, near 62 Villiers Street, in Toronto, Ontario. He was estimated to be between 25-45 years old. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 140 lbs and his length was measured at 5’11", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His teeth show heavy tartar accumulation and tobacco stain. His appendix was present and he was circumcised. He is thought to have been dead for a few days to a few weeks.

Hair: Brown, Wavy, Long, Long sideburns, a moustache which was long and curled to the side of lower lips.
Teeth: Had all of his teeth and there are some fillings as well as numerous cavities and dental abscesses.
Shoes: Canvas, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, A pair of Bauer brand shoes, made from canvas with silver stripes on the sides, size 10.
Other: Also had a pair of nail clippers; a bottle opener; and a small key on a key ring.
Watch: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Wearing a silver-coloured REMEX digital wrist watch
Socks: Wool, Blue, White, Mid-calf woolen socks which were blue on the sole and white on the top

Case reference: 2016061964.CaseDesc: On December 26, 1976, an unidentified Caucasian man, believed to be between the ages of 55 to 60 years old, was found in an abandoned blue van near 21 Blackburn Avenue, Toronto. He was malnourished, very dirty and heavily infested with lice. Locals knew him to live under the bridge at the foot of Blackburn Ave for about 15 years and he was known to local children as old Billy. He was circumcised. His feet showed frostbite which had become infected.

Hair: Grey, Long, Frontal balding and a grey beard 3 inches long
Teeth: Visible Missing, He had a few scattered carious teeth

Case reference: 2014006302.CaseDesc: On November 4, 2013, Gaetan Ethier was last seen when he was on a ferry crossing the Ottawa River towards Quebec. He has not been heard from since.

Case reference: 2021015231.CaseDesc: On December 8, 2017, at approximately 1:06 p.m., James Ryding was seen for the last time as he left his apartment in Niagara Falls, New York. During the time of his disappearance, James may have been despondent.

Case reference: 2015015784.CaseDesc: Richele Bear was reported missing to the Regina Police Service on September 5, 2013. She was last seen on August 9, 2013 leaving a residence in the 900 block of Rae Street. She is believed to live a high risk lifestyle.

Scar: Left Upper Arm, A round inoculation scar (10mm)

Case reference: 2014002802.CaseDesc: Gérard Sabourin was last seen around noon on August 7, 1975 when he left his furniture factory business on Saint-Nicolas Street in Laval, Quebec. His vehicle was found on Champlain Blvd. in Montreal, Quebec on August 19, 1975. Gérard has not been seen or heard from since.

Teeth: False, No teeth, wears upper and lower dental prostheses
Shirt: Black, Orange, Black with orange flowers

Case reference: 2014001572.CaseDesc: On July 19, 1970, Arthur Stephens left his home in Gimli, Manitoba. He had planned to go fishing in the Whiteshell Provincial Park. Arthur told his wife that he would return on July 21, 1970. He further advised her that if he was going to stay any longer, he would call her to let her know. By July 22, 1970, Arthur had not returned home and his wife hadn't received a phone call. She reported him missing to police that day. On August 1, 1970, Arthur's vehicle was located near Falcon Beach.  Extensive ground, lake and air searches were done of the area. All efforts to locate him failed to uncover any further leads. Arthur Stephens whereabouts remain unknown.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , Circular tattoo (exact design/pattern unknown)

Case reference: 2016052152.CaseDesc: On September 13, 2016 at approximately 9:30 p.m., John Casey was seen for the last time aboard a cruise vessel in transit between Cap-aux-Meules and Havre Saint-Pierre, Quebec. John has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014002821.CaseDesc: During the weekend of August 18, 1972, Dennis Simpson and a friend left for a fishing trip on McMillian Lake. When they failed to return by the 22nd, numerous people contacted police. Through investigation it was later determined that both men were last seen by a man on shore on Sunday the 20th, and their camp was still set up. They told the individual that they were going to make one more pass and then intended to break camp. Weather conditions at the time were such that there would have been rough water. Given this and the fact that the men were in a fairly small canoe, it was determined they may have capsized. An extensive land, water and air search did not find anything other than various articles that were identified as belonging to the two missing fishermen. Mr. Simpson has never been located.

Case reference: 2014005358.CaseDesc: On September 26, 2007, at approximately 8:00 a.m., Ana Jimenez was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. That day, Ana’s daughter found that her mother and all of her personal belongings were gone. Ana had been visiting from Columbia and was due to return on September 27, but never boarded her flight.

Case reference: 2014002572.CaseDesc: André Demange was last seen on September 2, 1983, in Montreal, Quebec. André's personal effects were found a few days later near the water close to Des Ormeaux and Bellerive street.

Case reference: 2016010572.CaseDesc: Richard Jones was last seen at his family’s residence in Brantford in late fall of 1975 and has not been seen since. Mr. Jones was also enrolled in the Graphic Design course at Sheridan College’s Oakville Campus in September of 1975.

Case reference: 2014022855.CaseDesc: In February 2013, a human skull was turned into Hinton RCMP by the Groeneveldt family. They located the skull in their garage under items that had been tucked away since the homeowner Leo Groeneveldt passed away many years earlier. The family believes Mr. Groeneveldt received the skull as a gag gift at a party he attended in Hinton in the late 1960s or early 1970s. The exact origin of the skull is unknown. Forensic examination of the skull shows it is that of an aboriginal male.

Case reference: 2018054173.CaseDesc: On September 23, 2018, at approximately 11:00am, Melvin Hillier was last seen at his home in Torbay, Newfoundland. Mr. Hillier had advised his family that he was going for a drive. Melvin’s blue pick-up truck was later located abandoned on the MV Legionnaire (one of the ferries that operates between Portugal Cove-St. Phillips and Bell Island, Newfoundland). Surveillance footage of the ferry shows Melvin walking around the lounge area during 1:45pm crossing. He was last observed on video between 1:50pm and 1:57pm.

Case reference: 2018064370.CaseDesc: On November 8, 2018, at approximately 8:30 am, Artur Mis was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Artur did not show up for work on November 9 and 12th, and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2017014429.CaseDesc: On June 7, 1982 the body of a man was recovered from the Bow River in Calgary, Alberta. The individual had multiple fingers amputated and had an unhealed break in his right arm.

Shirt: Yellow, Black, TSHIRT, Number 38 on front in black letters
Jacket: Beige, Blue, ZIPUP, Blue plaid inside
Denim, Blue, Sheepskin lining, snaps on front
Scar: Left Little Finger, On distal end of palmar side
Right Side Of Head, 3 cm long on right front parietal region
Tattoo: Left Hand, "F" between forefinger and thumb
Mark: Left Thigh, Biopsy site mid left femur
Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Forearm, Healing fracture of distal ulna
Amputation: Left Hand, Amputation through base of thumb
Left Hand, Amputation through PIP joint on the 2nd through 5th fingers
Right Hand, Amputation through PIP joint on the 2nd through 5th fingers

Case reference: 2006006399.CaseDesc: Gerald Joseph Bouchard was last seen on the morning of June 4, 1998, in the Town of Moosonee, Ontario. Moosonee is a remote Northern Ontario community situated on the coast of James Bay. There are no roads to Moosonee and access is by rail or aircraft. It is believed that Mr. Bouchard may have left Moosonee by jumping on a rail boxcar.

Case reference: 2014000002.CaseDesc: Dennis Bastillo was living with his family at the time of his disappearance. He was last seen near the Lions Gate Bridge between Vancouver and West Vancouver, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2006016699.CaseDesc: Michael Gadke and Morris Werenko were last seen in around Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario, and were last heard from as they were circling over Goulais Bay in a Cessna C-172 aircraft. The Cessna C-172, had white wings with red tips, a red fuselage with white stripe and white underside. Top of engine cowling was red.

Case reference: 2014005735.CaseDesc: On December 24, 1998, Rostyslav Korolko was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. At the time of his disappearance, Rostyslav was living with his brother and he had told him that he was going to look for work.

Case reference: 2017072938.CaseDesc: On March 8, 1988, Nadine Sharp was seen for the last time. She was a student at the University of Toronto and went missing from her home in Etobicoke, Ontario.

Case reference: 2010003799.CaseDesc: On Wednesday August 16, 1972, at 9:40 pm, 14 year-old Ingrid Bauer left her residence in Kleinburg, now the city of Vaughan, enroute to meet her boyfriend at his North Woodbridge home. She was last seen hitchhiking southbound along the west side of Islington Avenue.  She never arrived at her boyfriend’s residence that night.  An extensive search based on information received from the public failed to locate Ingrid Bauer.

Case reference: 2014004860.CaseDesc: Lesley Holmes was reported missing by her common law husband on December 23, 2005 after not having contact with her since November 23, 2005.  They had been living in a basement apartment in Toronto, the home of a friend. Lesley did not feel comfortable staying there without her common law who was away, so she moved out. She was believed to have spent some time in a shelter but this could not be confirmed by the shelter.  Her family has not seen or heard from her since that time.

Case reference: 2005003899.CaseDesc: On September 5, 2001, a Caucasian male was found on a bench in an outhouse on a cross country ski trail in the Laurentian Hills, Deep River. He was well-tanned and had recently got a sunburn on his face. He was circumcised and his appendix was present. He is estimated to have been dead for two to three days. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts this unidentified male is of European ancestry.

Glasses: Copper, Koh Sakai, frame model KS9365, reflective lens
Jewelry: Blue, Levi's, Blue faced, built in compass watch
Shoes: Black, Replay, size small running shoes
Jeans: Blue, Pepe, size 30, button fly front

Case reference: 2016068950.CaseDesc: On March 2, 1978, a Caucasian male jumped off the Municipal Parking Garage, 65 Pitt Street East, Windsor. Prior to jumping he had told an observer that his name was Lester, that he was depressed and had been in the hospital.

Case reference: 2018063450.CaseDesc: On July 30, 2003, at approximately 8:30am, William King was seen for the last time when he left his seniors residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2008011099.CaseDesc: Michael Hart left the Langton area to look for work in Western Canada as a skilled tradesman. He had maintained contact with his parents by telephone and through his banking. His parents are worried as they have had no contact with him since May 24, 1996.

Case reference: 2012749001.CaseDesc: Lonnie Boudreau was last seen in the city of Ottawa in February 1981. He has not been heard from since.

Hair: Blonde, Short, Straight, parted from left to right
Teeth: Good, Small gap between the two front teeth
Mark: Left Side Of Neck, Beauty mark

Case reference: 2014003615.CaseDesc: On September 26th, 1970, Mr. Claus and his friend were reported missing to police as they were overdue by boat. A pilot later spotted a swamped boat on Cormorant Lake, Manitoba and advised police. Despite patrols and dragging operations Mr. Claus was never located. His partner was later found and the cause of death determined to be drowning. No foul play is suspected in this matter.

Case reference: 2006017799.CaseDesc: Véronique Courchesne was last seen at her residence November 11, 1979. She was depressed due to a recent medical diagnosis. She had withdrawn money from her bank account prior to going missing. On December 31, 1979 she contacted her husband by telephone but has not been heard from since.

Amputation: Right Chest, Mastectomy to the right breast

Case reference: 2014001105.CaseDesc: The skeletal remains of a man were found along with camping gear in a wooded area near Chute Lake, BC in November 1991. He had a chip in one front tooth. It is estimated that he may have died several years prior to the discovery of his remains.

Jacket: Wool, Black, Suit coat, Herringbone pattern
Shirt: Cotton, Blue, White, Button-down Lumberman flannel
Shoes: Leather, Brown, Lace-up dress shoes, re-soled

Case reference: 2016068939.CaseDesc: A few days prior to April 3, 1968, the  remains of an adult male were found in a body of water. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 140lbs and his length was measured at 5'5", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He was believed to be in the water from a few weeks to a couple of months.

Hair: Grey, White, Hair was present at the temples
Teeth: Gold Visible, Upper and lower incisors had gold caps
Underwear: White boxer shorts with a red flowered pattern

Case reference: 2014002539.CaseDesc: On August 28, 1973, Amelie McArthur’s vehicle was found running with the lights on and the driver’s side door open on the Taylor Bridge in Taylor, BC. Amelie was last seen leaving her home in Taylor in that vehicle earlier that morning.

Case reference: 2012020108.CaseDesc: On March 26, 2006, Tommy Clément-Pépin was seen for the last time at approximately 11:00 a.m., in a hotel in Rouyn-Noranda, Quebec. His vehicle was located in a parking lot in Rouyn-Noranda, Quebec.

Case reference: 2018063054.CaseDesc: On June 1, 2018, Djvaid Ashami was seen for the last time as he left Montreal, Quebec, to go to Germany to join his father. On July 5, 2018, Djvaid and his father left Germany to go to the Shahre Naow District in Kabul, Afghanistan. The duo had planned to stay there until July 14. However, on July 11, Djavid left his hotel room for unknown reasons and without telling his father he was leaving. He has not been seen and his family has not heard from him since.

Case reference: 2014004467.CaseDesc: On November 16, 1997, Sadhi, Samia, Samir, and Saeed Jiredeh were last seen as they left their home with their father in Toronto, Ontario. That day, their parents had gotten into an argument prior to them leaving.

Case reference: 2014002919.CaseDesc: On November 12, 1988, Andrée Thibault was seen for the last time the Sainte-Marie District in Montreal, Quebec. Andrée may have been seen in Western Canada in the Vancouver, British-Columbia area.

Case reference: 2016040859.CaseDesc: On July 19, 2016, Deana Mildred Wertz was last seen at her residence on Yankee Flats Road near Salmon Arm BC. Later that same morning she spoke with family members by phone indicating she was going for a hike without her dog which was unusual. The area where Deanna is believed to have gone is the area surrounding Yankee Flats Rd near Salmon Arm BC which is steep mountainous terrain with a number of trail systems. She left without any personal possessions, cash or identification.

Case reference: 2014008479.CaseDesc: On May 2, 2014 William Grange was on vacation at the Cambridge Beach Resort and Spa in Bermuda. In the evening, he walked away from the resort.

Jewelry: Gold, wedding band with one diamond
Scar: Unknown, Small white scar, approx. 3" long, on top of hand, unknown right or left hand
Left Side Of Head, Surgical scar on left side of head/scalp from brain surgery

Case reference: 2006022699.CaseDesc: Nick Hibbart was prospecting when he was last seen by police at his camp on Gravel River on June 8, 1988. Police returned to the area on July 25, 1988, and found that the camp was burned to the ground. There was no sign of Mr. Hibbart and investigations have failed to determine his whereabouts.

Case reference: 2014006276.CaseDesc: On September 25, 2013, Mohamed Ali Qazi was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. At the time of his disappearance, Mohamed was in a Chevrolet Malibu rental vehicle that was later located in a shopping center in the city of Terrebonne, Quebec. His friend, Pierre Daniel, was also reported missing. The two men were often together.

Case reference: 2012020112.CaseDesc: On February 14 2007, Philippe Lajoie was seen for the last time in Saint-Didace in the Lanaudière region, Quebec. He left his parents’ home at approximately 6 p.m. to go to a pig farm located on Petite-Rivière Nord road, in Yamachiche in the Mauricie region of Quebec. His vehicle was found there the next day.

Case reference: 2014002921.CaseDesc: Alban Robichaud has been missing since May 30, 1991. Alban was employed with City Laundry and left this day at 3pm. Alban was seen in various uptown Saint John pubs and was last seen at Gene's Country Palace between 11:00 & 11:30 pm.

Case reference: 2020016353.CaseDesc: In April 2020, Travis Hollar last contacted his family. During the time of his disappearance, Travis was residing in Edmonton, Alberta, and was living a transient lifestyle. In the past, he suffered from a brain injury which caused diminished cognitive abilities.

Case reference: 2015018154.CaseDesc: On July 17, 1966, Delores Whiteman was last seen in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2016067449.CaseDesc: Jennifer Hillier-Penney was last seen in St. Anthony, NL on November 30, 2016.  It is believed that she went missing around 8:00 pm that evening from a residence in that community. Her personal belongings, including her cell phone, purse, shoes and jacket were left behind.

Tattoo: Capricorn sign on wrist, unsure of which wrist
Right Chest, eye of horus on the right rib
Scar: on knee from surgery, unsure which knee

Case reference: 2012020060.CaseDesc: Rene Mazerolle was last seen on July 28, 2008 when he was discharged from the Health Sciences Centre in Winnipeg.  Mr. Mazerolle's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014005249.CaseDesc: Peter Cory Butler was reported missing by family on March 24, 2008. He was last seen in downtown Whitecourt, AB on March 15, 2008.

Case reference: 2017015824.CaseDesc: On March 24, 2017, Hua Guo was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2017056036.CaseDesc: On July 9, 2017, Jason McGrath was last seen modifying his kayak at the family's cottage in Cape George, Nova Scotia. Jason had indicated that he intended on taking the kayak out onto the water. The kayak and Jason’s other personal belongings were recovered on a shore in Judique, Nova Scotia.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , Red circle with flames

Case reference: 2014001323.CaseDesc: Mary Kreiser was last seen September 16, 1987, at the Petro Canada Gas station in Westlock, Alberta.  She has not been heard from since October of 1987. It is believed that Mrs. Kreiser could be in Vancouver, BC area.

Case reference: 2014004551.CaseDesc: On June 30, 1984, Robert Plewes was last seen at his residence in Toronto, Ontario. His truck was found six days later near Algonquin Park located in Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005315.CaseDesc: Darryl Dubitski was last seen by his family leaving his residence in Edmonton, Alberta in December of 1982. Darryl had informed his family that he was travelling to the United States.

Case reference: 2014003688.CaseDesc: On September 23, 1981, William Earnshaw was hunting in the Clemenceau District, SK, southwest of Hudson Bay, SK. He had separated from two companions and failed to meet at their vehicle in the evening. An extensive search of the area has failed to locate Mr. Earnshaw.

Case reference: 1998000820.CaseDesc: Tom Marsden was last seen at a bush party near Summit Lake north of the City of Prince George.

Case reference: 2014001814.CaseDesc: On October 27, 1973, between 2:00pm and 5:00pm Steve Mysick packed a suitcase and left the residence where he was staying, located in Rapid City, Manitoba. Steve Mysick was an outpatient of the Brandon Mental Hospital and had been staying with his friends for 2.5 years at the time of his disappearance.   Mr. Mysick was last seen at the CP train station in Brandon, Manitoba. It is likely Mr. Mysick purchased the ticket to Winnipeg as he had very limited funds available and had lived in Winnipeg in the past. There is no indication if Mr. Mysick actually boarded the train to Winnipeg.   Steve Mysick has never been located and his whereabouts is unknown. Foul play is not suspected.

Case reference: 2015039943.CaseDesc: A family member reported that they had not seen Clarence Bigeye since 1974.

Case reference: 2017013508.CaseDesc: On March 26, 1989, the remains of a man were found in Fish Creek Park in Calgary, Alberta. The individual was missing four front teeth and may have worn a partial upper denture. Extensive dental work is present.

Case reference: 2014005318.CaseDesc: In November of 1983, Tony Spalancin was seen for the last time leaving his place of employment in Drayton Valley, Alberta. It is believed that Tony travelled to Calgary, Alberta, to seek new employment. His vehicle was later located in Calgary.

Case reference: 2014004910.CaseDesc: In 2002, Suppiah Dillirajah was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Prior to being reported missing, Suppiah had not been seen for five years.

Case reference: 2020008536.CaseDesc: On November 28, 1982, Heather Newton was last seen after she was discharged from the Queen Street Mental Health Centre in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014006235.CaseDesc: A lake freighter capsized in a violent storm on Lake Winnipeg, just north of Hecla Island, Manitoba. The vessel carried nine crew members and one passenger. There was only one survivor who managed to float on a piece of the wreckage to safety. All of the bodies of the remaining occupants were recovered with the exception of Allan Clemens and Tache Everett who were never located. Autopsies confirmed that the causes of death for those recovered were either drowning or death due to exposure in the cold water. Mr. Clemens and Mr. Everett are presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2014004969.CaseDesc: On July 21, 1966, a friend asked Ronnie Harper to help him lift one of his nets out of the waters of Red Sucker Lake. The two men set off in a canoe. When they arrived at the site, the men pulled the line attached to the net, but it didn't move. Increasing their efforts, the men pulled harder and the line attached to the weight came loose. The sudden shift caused both men to lose their footing and the canoe to overturn. The men attempted to move closer to shore by pushing the canoe. After a time, Mr. Harper told his friend he was too tired to hold on any longer. His companion continued moving the canoe. The survivor then realized Mr. Harper was no longer hanging on. Efforts to locate Mr. Harper were unsuccessful and it is presumed he drowned.

Case reference: 2014003900.CaseDesc: On December 8, 1977 at approximately 3 p.m., Ronald Foucault left his father’s business located in the city of Blainville, Quebec and told his father he had to travel to Texas, in the United States for work. There has been no news from Ronald since this time and it is impossible to confirm his arrival in the United States. In 1979, some of his belongings were found near the Dorval airport in Montreal, Quebec.
